head.title: Metro Business Briefing; POWER COMPANIES GET TAX REFUND

hedline.hl1: Metro Business Briefing; POWER COMPANIES GET TAX REFUND

abstract.p: Judge Thomas A Bishop of Connecticut State Superior Court rules in favor of Yankee Gas Services and Connecticut Light & Power and orders Meridien, Conn, to refund $15.6 million on ground that they were overtaxed (S)

block.p: A judge has ordered the city of Meriden, Conn., to refund $15.6 million to two power companies, saying it overtaxed them for nine years. Judge Thomas A. Bishop of State Superior Court ruled in favor of the companies, Yankee Gas Services and Connecticut Light and Power Company, on Friday. Meriden's city manager, Roger Kemp, said city leaders would meet today to consider whether to appeal. If the decision stands, the city may have to issue a bond to pay the refund, Mr. Kemp said, which he said would limit future spending. Judge Bishop's decision criticized the city's appraisal method as inconsistent and called its tax appeals process inadequate.
